Gomti was a serious, insightful, and hard working member of our team.  While there was a lot of chaos and different approaches to tackling the initial phases of our large enterprise application, Gomti lead the way in picking up tasks and developing her code without complaint. July 27, 2017, Gomti worked with Lorne in the same group

I met Gomti at Dimensional Fund Advisors, and the first things I noticed about her was a strong spirit and a desire to learn.  She has a passion for software and a passion for quality.  Even though I had been a software developer for 15 years at the time, I found myself learning from her.  She has a very open attitude, enthusiasm and a willingness to share her knowledge with anyone who is interested.  This created an environment of openness and learning, and made for a highly motivated team.  We were not focused on conflicts or doubt, but worked as a team to produce some of the highest quality software I have seen in my career.  It was a pleasure and a learning experience to work with Gomti, and I would gladly work with her again.

Gomti is endlessly curious about all aspects of software development. She can discuss, with you, the finer points of Agile development principles, pivot to architectural styles, and end somewhere in design patterns. First and foremost, she wants to continuously improve her talents and skills, but she knows that personal growth and team growth are intrinsically linked. Therefore, she wants to grow everyone’s talents and skills along with her own. Working with Gomti is a unique experience that will make you a better developer. She is an asset to any organization.

Trevor Conn
Software Developer -- Principal Engineer at Dell
July 23, 2017, Trevor was senior to Gomti but didn’t manage directly

I work with Gomti as the Solution Architect with oversight for her feature team. Gomti has a strong passion for code quality and actively engaged me with regard to improving the legacy codebase she inherited. She is very enthusiastic about bringing concepts related to Onion Architecture and Domain Driven Design to new features that her team develops in order to slowly shift the existing codebase toward something more maintainable and extensible. Gomti also has excellent knowledge of the Scrum process and Agile principles. She has pro-actively made suggestions during retrospectives which have increased the value of this process for her team. She is the newest member of her feature team and has integrated well with her peers. She is a pleasure to work with.

Rahul Satasia
Software Dev Senior Engineer at Dell
July 18, 2017, Gomti worked with Rahul in the same group

Gomti Mehta is passionate software developer. She believes that to build a good software product, its important to understand and follow good engineering principles. She believes the good code quality, test driven development are the keys that can keep code base from turning into legacy. She is an advocate of "professionalism in software development" and an advocate of "Principles from Agile Manifesto". She always looks for opportunities to improve code quality while getting her work done. She always gives suggestions on how to improve the process and how important it is for a development team to understand the business and vision of product to build the right product. She is not shy in sharing her believes and suggestions openly. She has great social skills and is great team player.
